name: Vobi
tag_list: contextual-collaboration, social-media-algorithms, voice-collaboration, video-conferencing, document-sharing, hosted-voice, collaboration-technology, social-network, collaboration
overview:
Headquartered in Austin, TX, Vobi is a pioneer in the development of Automated Contextual Collaboration (ACC) solutions for businesses and consumers.

The company’s platform, Peering Cloud, utilizes a combination of voice, collaboration technologies, and social media algorithms to deliver rich, efficient and seamless interaction across IP, legacy and mobile networks. Vobi is privately-held, founded by Mark Castleman, founder of several successful communications service providers, and chief executive officer of PBXCentral, a leading provider of hosted communications services for businesses. Vobi’s Peering Cloud platform uses voice calls and social media algorithms to instantly locate, capture and deliver common content to session participants. Once the content is provided, users can interact through most methods of collaboration, including voice and video conferencing, desktop and document sharing, email, chat, and other media. The platform is application-agnostic, and can integrate with any number of legacy conferencing and collaboration solutions. In addition, Vobi’s Peering Cloud platform can deliver content across IP, TDM and wireless networks, giving users seamless access to information in any environment. Vobi offer its solutions through a distribution network of integrators, resellers, and service providers that include carriers, hosted communications providers and aggregators.
